title: How to Make Shipwreck

steps.headline: Spray a 2 quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Peel and slice onions and the potatoes and the celery.
Place a layer onions in the bottom of baking or casserole dish then season with salt and pepper.
steps.description: You can add other herbs and spices at this stage of you wish.

steps.headline: Place the sliced potatoes over onions and season with salt and pepper again if desired.
steps.description: Be careful not to over salt the dish.

steps.headline: Add the raw ground or minced beef and pat it to ensure it evenly cover vegetables.
steps.description: Add more seasoning with salt and pepper or anything else if desired.

steps.headline: Spread the uncooked rice over ground beef.
steps.description: Be careful to distribute it evenly.

steps.headline: Heat the water then mix it together with the contents of can of soup.
steps.description: If you have left over homemade soup, use this instead. Pour the soup and water mix over the layers in your dish.

steps.headline: Cover and bake for two hours or until the potatoes, celery and onions are tender.
Serves at least 4 and probably closer to 6 hungry people.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Spray a 2 quart casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray.  Peel and slice onions and the potatoes and the celery.  Place a layer onions in the bottom of baking or casserole dish then season with salt and pepper. You can add other herbs and spices at this stage of you wish. Place the sliced potatoes over onions and season with salt and pepper again if desired. Be careful not to over salt the dish. Add the raw ground or minced beef and pat it to ensure it evenly cover vegetables. Add more seasoning with salt and pepper or anything else if desired. Spread the uncooked rice over ground beef. Be careful to distribute it evenly. Top with the prepared celery.  Heat the water then mix it together with the contents of can of soup. If you have left over homemade soup, use this instead. Pour the soup and water mix over the layers in your dish. Cover and bake for two hours or until the potatoes, celery and onions are tender.  Serves at least 4 and probably closer to 6 hungry people.  Serve with a green salad.
